required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Short-Term Evaluation of Corneal Staining With Balafilcon A Lenses and Two Multi-Purpose Solutions

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: An investigational multi-purpose solution (MPS)was clinically evaluated against Biotrue MPS at specific time points over the course of four days. The study was conducted with PureVision lenses.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour on Day 1, 2 hours on Day 2, 4 hours on Day 3 and End of Day on Day 4
primary_outcome.description: All participants were contact lenses wearers and were evaluated with a Corneal Staining at 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours and end of day. The corneal staining test is performed using fluorescein drops in the eye and ultraviolet illumination to determine if there has been any damage to the cornea from the use of the lens solutions or from the use of the contact lens.

secondary_outcome.description: Subject asked which solution they prefer based on comfort level.
All subjects were asked to rate their lens comfort at each visit based on an 11 point scale where 0 meant that the lens could not be tolerated and 10 indicated that the lens could not be felt.

clinical_study.keyword: Corneal staining and comfort evaluation in normal, habitual contact lens wearers.

group.title: Biotrue/Investigational MPS
group.description: Paired/parallel eye evaluation; each subject used both study treatments and were tested at 1 hour, 2hours, 4 hours and end of day during a 4 day period.

group.title: Biotrue/Investigational MPS
group.description: Paired/parallel eye evaluation; each subject used both study treatments and were tested at 1 hour, 2hours, 4 hours and end of day during a 4 day period.

measure.title: Gender, Customized
measure.description: Gender was not an analysis endpoint for this study.

outcome.title: Corneal Staining by Wear Time
outcome.description: All participants were contact lenses wearers and were evaluated with a Corneal Staining at 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours and end of day. The corneal staining test is performed using fluorescein drops in the eye and ultraviolet illumination to determine if there has been any damage to the cornea from the use of the lens solutions or from the use of the contact lens.
outcome.time_frame: 1 hour on Day 1, 2 hours on Day 2, 4 hours on Day 3 and End of Day on Day 4
outcome.population: Corneal Staining Severity at Scheduled Visits (Safety Population)

group.title: Investigational MPS

measure.description: All participants were contact lenses wearers and were evaluated with a Corneal Staining at 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours and end of day. The corneal staining test is performed using fluorescein drops in the eye and ultraviolet illumination to determine if there has been any damage to the cornea from the use of the lens solutions or from the use of the contact lens.

outcome.population: All subjects who completed the study were included in the analysis per protocol.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
